alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 1:23PM EST until December 29 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Rhode Island... Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Providence and Kent Counties. For the Sudbury River...including Saxonville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sudbury River at Saxonville. * WHEN...From this evening to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding will affect low lying areas along the river in Wayland, including a portion of Shore Road and Pelham Island Road near Heards Pond. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to flood stage this evening. It will then fall to 9.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 9.9 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EST.
